page.title: 03Peter Tavy:Church and Inn
page.content: One of the oldest buildings in the village is the Inn,which was built in the fifteenth century.Peter Tavy also has a church with a tower.This is thought to have been built originally in the fourteenth century in the cruciform style.The church is named St.Peters.As St.Peter is supposed to hold the keys to heaven there is a pair of crossed keys on the font inside the door. The graveyard has some very old graves in it,including graves of children who died as young as three days old.The graveyard also has some new graves,some as recent as 1984. There is a memorial there in remembrance of the people who died in the Second World War.
